intro: Boerhavia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered billygoat weed, is a flowering plant native to Africa, particularly South Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink or red flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Boerhavia parviflora is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
